name: angular
column8: Typescript based web application framework. It is widely used for building single-page front-ended applications using HTML and TypeScript. Angular facilitates modularized code that is less complex to be developed
column9: tested and maintained. Some times it is also mentioned as Angular 2+. Angular is a complete rewrite of AngularJS which is Javascript based and therefore the two should not be confused. Nevertheless
column10: Typescript is a superset of Javascript and therefore already developed applications in Javascript are compatible with Typescript.

name: apigee
description: ApiGee does support various deployment model types
column7: public cloud (AWS) and SaaS. For the deployment model
column8: on-premise private cloud was selected due to current AAC strategy on use of high CIA/CRA application components in public cloud or as SaaS package. Deployment model will be reviewed in future when new AAC strategy and roadmap on public cloud and SaaS is introduced.

name: Hyperledger Fabric
description: Fabric is a modular and extensible open-source system for deploying and operating permissioned blockchains

name: apache kafka
description: By definition Apache Kafka is a distributed streaming platform that offers real-time streaming and messaging service between producer and consumer application component. Producer application streams records to structured ordered commit log - partition. Each record is identified by unique offset. Consumer application component on the data stream maintains the offset position in partition and process the stream of records produced to it.

name: GIT
description: Git is a free and open source distributed version control system designed to handle everything from small to very large projects with speed and efficiency.
